website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced pail that's easy to manage. Gets mixed reviews on odor control.
pros: Convenient design opens for bag removal at front so you don't need to move the pail
Clamps, thick collection bag and carbon filter system combat odors
cons: Some note that it requires a bit of force to get the diaper into the collection bin
Reviews of its odor control capabilities are mixed

customer_reviews.title: Twin mom here - Buy a Munchkin instead
customer_reviews.text: Listen up soon to be parents - I am a twin mom to two 13 month olds (that’s a lot of diapers so far) and I have used both the Munchkin diaper pail and this one. I HIGHLY recommend the Munchkin one unless you will be changing the bag EVERY day and only having one baby. This pail is frustraiting to get the diaper into the second resovoir, causing you to have to shake the pail (this shaking the doodoo scent out into the room), plus it holds about 1/4 of the diapers the Munchkin does.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Very poor design. Takes half the amount of soiled diapers as the original Diaper Genie Elite. This means more bag changes, more wasted bag. Bags rip easily thanks to the poor design of having the latch mechanism so sharp. We have five kids, three in diapers and go through many changes. We have one of each Diaper Genie model and you can see the difference in the amount of diapers the old model vs the new will hold in my photo. I'm positive the company changed the design in order to induce more purchases of the refill bags. Both models block the odor well. Just don't breathe when opening the lid to insert the next dirty diaper🤧😷
customer_reviews.author: Aihab Gerges

customer_reviews.title: This item came heavily recommended by several of our friends but it seems that ...
customer_reviews.text: This item came heavily recommended by several of our friends but it seems that the design has changed since they used it. I was under the impression this would lock the odor away but it is sub-par at best. We've taken to using left over grocery bags as they are more effective. I suspect the older model that "twisted" the diapers and sealed them was far more effective at odor control. This is just a fancy trashcan with overpriced refills. I recommend you look for another product. EDIT: after a bit of research I found the original design twisted the diapers sealing in the odor. This module doesn't do that and isn't effective at controlling odor. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: At the beggining I was happy with this purchase but now I would send this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a few months since I am using it. At the beggining I was happy with this purchase but now I would send this item back if I could. The bad smell of the diapers is all around the house, I changed the filter also but anyway no result. I have just one baby, and I have to change the bags twice a week which is very frustrating. I would not recommend it to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina.R.

customer_reviews.title: They don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: These things are garbage. I’ve gone through two in 18 months, they just don’t hold up. Cheaply made, they fall apart. The original diaper genie design was 100x better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: This one seems to be about the same size but a MUCH smaller space for the dirty diapers. Therefore
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version that broke so had to get a new one. This one seems to be about the same size but a MUCH smaller space for the dirty diapers. Therefore, you have to change the bag more and waste more of the EXPENSIVE refill bags. Such a ploy to get you to spend more $$ as if you don't spend enough!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: The newest model is terrible! Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: What happened to the Diaper Genie? We had one we bought in 2013 that worked great for two years. Then we bought another in early 2015 that worked well for another two and a half years. We just bought a new one and it’s terrible. They redesigned it and made it a million times worse. Instead of diapers getting stuck occasionally, almost every diaper gets stuck. It has a much smaller capacity. It’s very hard to open it and cut a new bag. This is seriously the worst design job I’ve ever seen. I don’t understand— the old design worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: NancyDrew919

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but not executed as well as could have been the case
customer_reviews.text: The "seal" between the poopy diapers and that outside world is not as good as has been in previous iterations of this product. They've tried to do an "airlock" mechanism so that when you open the lid on the top, a smaller lid on the bottom closes. While this is really a genius idea (and who hasn't thought of this whilst trying to quickly fling a poopy diaper into a diaper pail) the execution is not great because the "airlock" is not actually sealed so a little whiff of stench gets through every you open the pail.
customer_reviews.author: Pahrumpian

customer_reviews.title: THIS MODEL SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: This model sucks! when you put the diapers in, the smell of other diapers hit you right away! I had a great diaper genie yrs ago when my now 6 yr old daughter was a baby. That model was Great!That's what made me want to get this one.Another thing that sucks is you have to push down the other diapers down with your hands after about 3 to 4 diapers because the foot pedel won't alow for the diaper to go down.Another thing is it doesn't come fully assembled like they claim!
customer_reviews.author: Momma bear

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful odor control for diapers or litter box waste!
customer_reviews.text: I use this baby diaper genie for storing cat litter box waste until ready for disposal. The unit works very well in controlling odor, and is more economical than the actual "Pet Genie". It comes with a pack with multiple bags and a bacterial/odor control packet. The product is very easy to set up and use. It has a foot control to open, so you don't need to touch the material to be disposed of. Changing the bag is easy, and directions are readily available, if needed. This product has eliminated the litter box odor, and would definitely control diaper odor as well. It comes in white or pastel colors.
customer_reviews.author: E. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older/original diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: We finally had to replace our diaper Genie after having the old model for 6 years (used for 3 babies and put away when we had no need for it in-between babies) of course we loved our older modeled diaper genie and were bummed to see they changed the pail to this one... we bought it and gave it a try anyway... and... we miss the older style! This one doesn’t hold as many diapers and it lets out the smell as soon as you open it because of the way it opens! The older style held more and hardly let any smell out when throwing a diaper away.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany D.

customer_reviews.title: Works good for adult diapers and cat litter too
customer_reviews.text: My old school diaper pail had perforated bags and they were too small for large adult diapers. This one uses a constant bag that gets as long as it needs to be. I also use it for cat litter clumps. The pail can sit for a week with soiled diapers and dirty litter in it and no one would ever know. If you are a caregiver and wish the house didn't smell like a diaper until trash day then you will be thankful for this double odor locking system with a carbon filter and infinity bag feature.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Works well for disposables, but not for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: When our daughter was born, we started off using disposables and the Genie worked perfectly for those. It held a decent amount of diapers and kept smells trapped without any issues. We eventually switched to using cloth diapers after a few months and didn't like that you can't use reusable bags with the Genie. We reused one of the bag rings to insert a reusable bag, but it didn't work well. I ended up selling this on Facebook marketplace after about 7 months of usage to find something that worked well with reusable bags and held more cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie C.

customer_reviews.title: Good but I prefer the older version (elite)
customer_reviews.text: I originally had the diaper genie Elite (older version) and it is bigger then this one and honestly better, never had an issue with it wish I would have kept it but I gave it away. This one doesn’t hold as many diapers as I would like and I have an issue with it closing, if the bag is not pulled down enough it doesn’t shut properly and I have had this issue many times. But other then that it’s good. I don’t smell the diapers (as long as I make sure the thing shuts all the way)
customer_reviews.author: A&GT

customer_reviews.title: Great for Adult Colostomy Disposals Too
customer_reviews.text: Also excellent for disposing of adult colostomy pouches. We keep the diaper pail in our bathroom, and it holds a week's worth of disposables (our garbage pickup is once a week) without a whiff of odor in the bathroom. We were having a terrible odor problem with a standard garbage container in the Arizona heat in our enclosed garage (the cars were beginning to smell), but this has not only solved the problem, but is more convenient because it can be kept in the house. I was thinking I would have to buy 2 diaper pails to get us thru a full week, but not so - amazing capacity. This product has solved a real problem for us. Thanks Playtex!
customer_reviews.author: JudyinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Happy purchase after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at diaper pail reviews for some time. Choosing between this and Munchkin step pail. Opted for this for cheaper bag options. As our baby grew older, the soiled diapers became stinkier so I finally got this after 18 months. Wish I got it sooner. It doesn't stink as much as a regular trash can when you open the lid but it's not 100% stink proof. I put a baking soda box and some other carbon pack in the bottom part to help. Bag refills are from costco. They keep in the smell better.Some reviews said it was hard to cut the plastic but no complains from me.
customer_reviews.author: Miss

customer_reviews.title: Holds half as many diaper vs older version.
customer_reviews.text: This does the job of holding diapers but this new version is not as good as the old version. This only holds about half as many diapers when full compared to the older version. They are basically the same size on the outside too. See picture for capacity comparison, both emptied when full, new one is on the left old version on the right. If you can find the older version of this I would recommend getting that one instead of this version.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Vogler

customer_reviews.title: Works for adult diapers as well
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elders diapers. It hides to smell much better than the bag and dump we were utilizing in his bathroom. He doesn't got through as many in a day as a new born BUT his are much bigger than a new baby so the bags fill up pretty much the same..easy for him to use. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bexxy

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made Product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these in less than 3 months so I would say this is a low-quality product. The first one broke; the trap door on the inside stopped opening up so I assumed it was my fault, threw it away, & sent for a new one. If this new one quits on my then I’ll know for sure, it’s a crap product but I’m going to give it another chance. But as of now, I don’t recommend anyone else buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Not odorless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my first daughter in December 2019. I didn't buy it on amazon, but i ordered it again in October because the one i bought in December broke, which is terrible, but since i didn't find any other product better i ended up buying it again. The only thing is that even with the "odorless" on the announcement, it still smells really bad. I'd recommend it if you can't find anything better. And also, the first one i bought at target and it lasted only 10 months so that's why i bought it again. It's not a bad product, it just doesn't control the odor like it says
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Very appreciated
customer_reviews.text: We never own a diaper genie and all I can say is why not!? This genie literally is the best on concealing the diaper smell and consolidating them. It took me awhile to figure out how to put the bag in n such. But everything else is common sense with the bag. Really love this product and would recommend to at least have this as one less stressor with a new born (stink smelling your home)
customer_reviews.author: Angie Mauga

customer_reviews.title: nothing like the original diaoee genie
customer_reviews.text: So I had a diaper genie 17 years ago with my first daughter. I now have a four week old baby and wanted another one for this child. This new model of the diaper genie socks it doesn't trap in the odors as soon as you drop a diaper in pail you get a strong whiff of dirty diapers. I wonder why Playtex changed from their original design the first one was so much better. Also you have to change out the diapers frequently with this new design. The original genie i changed every two weeks. I would suggest customers to purchase another diaper pail im only using this one because now im stuck with it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely worth the money. Must have for the nursery!
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper genie! For years, I have used the old diaper dekor plus. However, it was not keeping the smell out of the room. Just after a stinky diaper or two, the room was smelling bad. So I thought I’d give this one a try. With the way that it is made, it totally blocks out the odor! The only time I smell anything from it is when I open it to put a diaper in. It has a carbon filter that has to be replaced every so often. Few months maybe. I empty when there about 12 diapers. I love this paid and it was completely, 100% worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not containing odor
customer_reviews.text: This is just not working - it contains diaper odor only as long as lid is closed, but upon pushing foot pedal, the odor is unbearable. Looks like the sides don't stayed closed when lid is open. I didn't realize this would be a problem since I've never used one before - it could be a defect or damage from shipment I suppose but it's been broken then since first use because it has never contained the odor. I am leery of trying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use. Tucks away in a corner and can hold a lot of diapers (although we dont wait too long because of the smell). While it is bigger and holds more diapers, remember that you will need to buy more refills because of that. The pros and cons. We liked it so much we bought 2. And I would probably give it as a gift if it ever appears on a friends registry because of the ease of use. It does very good in containing the diaper smell too. In addition to the charcoal filter, we combat the smell by occasionally spraying disinfecting spray inside. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Paul O

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this used to be such a good product when they twisted. I should have read into how this works. Having to tie it off, cut it and tie again as it gets full is a pain in the butt. I should have gotten the other popular diaper pail that doesn't require refills etc. This works but when you have a newborn, the extra work isnt really a blast. Plus, the door to access the filled bag broke very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So-so, it will do for newborns...
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for what it is....but the plastic material is not very durable so parts can easily break. Think it should be more like $19.99 for the quality. The bag tearing piece snapped off on the first one we bought. We repurchased and hope this one will not break. It’s better than diapers in the garbage 🤷🏽‍♀️. It contains the smell well enough (we change it out every couple days).
customer_reviews.author: SpittenImage

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. The design sucks. I don’t know why they changed this from the original but this one has 3 areas that the diaper has to pass through. The opening, the first barrier and then the second barrier. If your kid takes a huge crap it won’t pass through the second and the third barrier. COME ON PLAYTEX YOUR BETTER THAN THIS. Incidentally, my kid had diarrhea and I was trying to stuff the diaper through the second barrier, needless to say it caused the diaper to explode and crap was literally everywhere. I threw this thing in the trash where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Put together in less than a minute. 1000 times better than the original diaper genie that doesn’t have the step to open the lid! I bought two one for each of my kids rooms. So far so good! Edited: for some unknown reason one of the diaper genies became undone. We haven’t handled it any differently from the other one but it’s kid stopped closing. I was able to check the mechanics of the other diaper genie in I figure out the issue but it was a pain. Hoping this doesn’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Antionette

customer_reviews.title: This design is far inferior to the previous generation.
customer_reviews.text: It would be difficult for me to be any less satisfied with this product. I bought this recently when my old, previous generation diaper genie broke. This one is horrible. The capacity is smaller, the unloading of the full pail is more difficult, and at least on the one I bought, the open/close mechanism has never worked right. Often times it gets stuck open. Other times it won't open at all. I hate this thing. I encourage you to save yourself the hassle and spend the extra bucks to get an Ubbi or try to find the previous generation Diaper Genie.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kniffel

customer_reviews.title: Its works great... for a time.
customer_reviews.text: It worked amazingly for a month or so and then started falling to pieces everytime it was opened after that. (When it does open that is..) It holds smells in really well but goodness the rank smell that smack you in the face when you open it is awful. It holds alot of diapers HOWEVER it generally has to be changed every 1-2 days if you have a messy babe. It was the most amazing thing to me until it just wasn't. I wont say it's a waste of money, I got to use it and for a time it did its job.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t seem like the doors open up wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Diaper gene is not for me... diapers are constantly getting clogged in the middle part, doesn’t seem like the doors open up wide enough. I broke my first one because a bunch of diapers got stuck in the middle separated piece. Also, with how many diapers baby produces daily, the bag is small- have to change it almost daily. So what’s the point? A day of diapers sitting in the trash is not long enough for it to get stinky anyway...
customer_reviews.author: Maria D

customer_reviews.title: Try another brand!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made, my first one broke within a week and I had to order another. The only positive thing I will say is that it does keep in the smell and it is easy to change. However, it breaks easily and my sons diapers don’t even fit through the small opening. So if I had a big number 2 I have to either try to squeeze it through the hole or put it in my regular trash which defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A Remy

customer_reviews.title: Use daily, works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, all inclusive with first line (tie to make bag), sleek appearance. I used one of these for years and bought this one as a replacement. This one opens differently than the older style,... improved access to removing and disposing of content. Incidentally, I use to hold puppy poo bags (not diapers) and keep outside in a covered area. No smell; no flies; easy disposal. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AmorBIz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't properly seal the odor
customer_reviews.text: I have used Playtex brand previously with an older version of this pail that worked better than this one. This updated model causes the plastic to tear and it does not properly seal the odor. Taking the filled bag out is also a hassle with this one because of the way the door opens. The door keeps closing. Keeping the door open while also trying to pull out the bag, cut it and close it with a knot can be challenging as the door doesn't stay open and keeps coming in the way. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The concept of the diaper genie is a great idea. I do have a few issues with this product. The worst quality is the smell! I know we are dealing with dirty diapers, but the pack inserts they give dosnt even help. Maybe making the actual bag materials with some kind of scent would help. My 2nd issue is the size of it. I have twins so I’m constantly changing the bags. I know not everyone has double dirty diapers to change, but if they offered a larger size genie that would be a plus....... design and function I would give 5 stars, but the smell issue and size a 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible compared to last gen - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This latest model is awful. Totally stupid design from an engineering perspective. We have ran through 3 of these in 3 years when moving to a larger house and having more children. we still have the our first one , with the old design we bought with our first child. This latest design surely wasn’t reliability tested. Constantly breaking opening mechanism , terrible fit of the door after a short number of uses, holds about 1/2 the diapers as the previous version. We are throwing our last one away and changing brands
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Green

customer_reviews.title: Like this one better because it has a foot pedal ...
customer_reviews.text: Have the arm and hammer pale as well. Like this one better because it has a foot pedal to open lid. I like not having to touch it. Diaper bags are quite different to change and I don’t think they hold as many diapers between changing the bag, as the arm and hammer one I have, it not have to push the dirty diaper through the opening like you have to in the other one makes it all worth it. I like this one the best.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Well for the price, I feel this is unacceptable. The item is supposed to come with a filter, but instead it came with a pack of tampons... Yeah, I do not need those, I need a filter. There is no method to contact the manufacturer, so really my only option is to return it. Should Amazon "make it right", I will update my review, otherwise assume they did not and probably should look elsewhere for a more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a hand me down diaper genie when a plastic piece snapped and it became unusable. My only complaint with this newer model is that the compartment that opens at the bottom is flimsy and doesn’t line up with the rest for bottom piece correctly. It also opens much lower than where the diapers end in the bag if you fill it alll the way so you have to do some finagling to get it out. Holds smells great and will last through a few babies!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Big nope.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. I had one from my first kid that lasted us 5 years of continuous use. It was awesome, but after 5 yrs it finally gave out. I ordered this one as a replacement and the changes they’ve made are awful. It doesn’t hold nearly as many diapers and after 7 months the front panel has snapped off and the top lid no longer closes. Don’t waste your time or money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbie

customer_reviews.title: Best nursery purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best baby items we bought for the nursery. We only have to change it once a week or so. It’s so easy to open with the foot petal, which is awesome when you have your hands full. Our little one is on a special formula that makes his poop stink pretty bad, but once we put it in, you can’t smell anything! I would purchase this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: K&J Smith

customer_reviews.title: This stinks. Literally.
customer_reviews.text: This product stinks. Literally. After less than a month, the entire nursery smells like dirty diapers and it gets changed every 3 days because it holds so few diapers. I miss my old Diaper Champ! Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PassionBuzz

customer_reviews.title: Use for my dog run
customer_reviews.text: I have a small place and the dogs need to use part of the patio when they can't wait for a walk. This is perfect for throwing the doggy bags in and keeping the place smelling nice even in the summer heat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: No Smell
customer_reviews.text: I must admit I was skeptical but, I'll admit, this is a great device to have when dealing with diapers. My only complaint is the cutter for this model is extremely dull. I've gotten to the point that I keep a pair of scissors handy when emptying the bin. We got an older model Genie as a shower present and it cuts really well. One pass over the cutter and done.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Came assembled and ready
customer_reviews.text: Love that the pail came assembled and ready to use. The scent pack was not quality, but I know I`ll be replacing it shortly anyways. The bags were easy to add, and the bag cutter on the inside was placed perfectly for use and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Narrow profile, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: We have not yet "tested" this with a diaper so I can't speak to how well it actually contains odors. We got this one because it was the diaper pail with the narrowest profile and we needed to put it in between the diaper changing table and our guest bunk beds. It seems clean and modern and doesn't really stick out in any kind of design statement - which is a good thing to us! A bit pricey, and not sure how excited I am that we have to buy diaper genie branded refill bags, but it seemed like the best solution for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bring back the Playtex® Diaper Genie® Elite!!!
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I would highly recommend the older Elite model, which for some reason was discontinued. The Elite worked with no issues from Feb 2015-Jan 2019. We bought the Complete to replace the Elite in Jan 2019. We had nothing but problems with the new model. First off it does not take anywhere near what the older model handled. Secondly, this new model broke multiple times, which I did fix a few times as I am handy but this last time, 6 months after buying it, it finally broke for the last time. I would not recommend this to anyone. Look elsewhere until they bring back the elite model.
customer_reviews.author: MollyM

customer_reviews.title: So convenient and scent-locking
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I didn’t have a diaper pail before this. I should have bought one from the get go! It keeps the scent in (cannot smell it at all except for when you open the lid to dispose of a diaper). The plastic bags are so easy to set up and it makes it so easy to replace the bags after the bin is full and has been emptied. Literally the best and most value for your money!
customer_reviews.author: SKKE

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for pets (1 dog, 1 cat)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now and have found it very useful. We put poop from our cat and dog and so far nobody complained of the smell. Even when I'm emptying it, the smell isn't horrible if you try to seal it before separating it from the diaper genie. I bought this instead of the litter genie because I like the foot press/pedal. Overall, I'm pleased, because it provides me a convenient way to throw away the poop without putting it in our garbage bag.
customer_reviews.author: N. Huynh

customer_reviews.title: There is something magical about a diaper genie. Wish we had this with the first child.
customer_reviews.text: So when we first got home from the hospital I swore this thing was magical. I just kept loading it up with diapers and it seemed to have a bottomless pit. But then I had to change the bag. Pretty simple process. And boy does it help. There was no scent when we were breast feeding but when we started supplementing with formula the diapers smell got a little worse. The thing keeps the funk trapped in. We were worried since the girls share a room. No complaints a month in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much worse than the older version
customer_reviews.text: What was wrong with the old model diaper Genie, the one where you had to rotate the handle? That one was truly smell-proof, easy to use, and durable. This one is very poorly designed and I suspect will not be smell-proof at all once the baby is on solids. Bought it because there was nothing better available but really miss the old model we had with our first child. Wish we hadn't gotten rid of it!
customer_reviews.author: OLGA D

customer_reviews.title: This has been a good diaper pail for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the diaper genie for over a year now, and I’ve been pleased with it. It does Lock in odor (until you open it to throw another away. I’m honestly not sure how that can be avoided, no matter how you design it). Bag needs changed about every two days. You need a very specific bag for it, but they are easy to find at Costco, Walmart etc. The pail has held up well, nothing has broken. Though twice I’ve had an issue with the bags splitting down the side, but that is rare. Overall I’d say it does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try something different after having the munchkin step pail for the first child. I wish I would have bought the same pale again. The Diaper Genie has absolutely no scent control at all, has to be changed every day, doesn't hold very many diapers. This is probably a good thing because the scent would be even more out of control with more diapers. Don't waste your money, by the munchkin step pail.
customer_reviews.author: demonphoenix88

customer_reviews.title: Not Cost Effective for Twins
customer_reviews.text: This product is helpful. It's great to not have to smell stinky diapers all the time. However, I have twins and they produce a lot of diapers. I have gone through one refill a week on these. It is not cost effective to keep it up for us. The refills are pricey and don't hold too much. My boys are in size 4 diapers now, one full bag holds about 10 diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Product!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our diaper genie!!! Our only complaint is we wish it weren’t so small to hold more diapers at one time, but other than that, wonderful! We received one as a gift from our baby registry and it’s had to get a second one for a different room in our house. Does a great job of keeping the smell contained and the bags are very simple to change out. Would DEFINITELY recommend to anyone looking to hide a stinky diaper smell.
customer_reviews.author: Barking Shark

customer_reviews.title: Life Hack....Use this in the garage for your dog's poop bags.
customer_reviews.text: We moved and went from a house where we could keep our garbage cans outside all week, to a townhouse where we needed to keep the garbage can in the garage until garbage day. I throw the dog's poop bags in the diaper genie and there was no smell in the garage all summer long, even in extreme heat! Then once a week, I tie up the bag and put it out on garbage night. Don't know what I would do without this!
customer_reviews.author: KC PDX

customer_reviews.title: Stinks up room as soon as you open to add a diaper
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was an upgrade from the genie expressions since it had the convenience of a foot pedal but I was wrong. Even though the other one required pushing the diaper in, it concealed odors. This one doesn't do that. You get a whiff a poop that fills the room each time opened to add new diaper. No fun. I wish I would've kept the genie expressions.
customer_reviews.author: Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. I like how easy it was to install and replace the bags when full. Since our newborn is requiring an average of 10 diaper change per day, I am emptying the trash can every other day just to keep the smell in check. I didn't have an issues with odours admitting from the diaper genie yet. Highly recommended to new parents or baby registry for expecting parents.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey P

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I got sick of having nasty diapers in the trash when he was first born I would just toss them into a garbage pail in the garage, now that it’s finally summer here in Michigan this plan is, well stinky! SoI figured why not try it. Works great but fills up quickly (maybe a days worth of diapers) which can get pricey quickly buying refill bags , but it’s working for what I needed it for!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed after only 1 month
customer_reviews.text: No smell really comes from it but I've also only been using it for a month. The lid on this will not shut with only 4 weeks of use. On of the clamps on the inside doesn't move. I had a gift card when I bought this so it was only like $7 and I'm glad it only cost that much out of our pockets because I wouldn't spend the regular price on this again. Seems poorly out together to only work for 1 month before having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Mann

customer_reviews.title: Good pail
customer_reviews.text: This works great to get rid of my son's diapers. My only issue is that if I have recently put in a poopy diaper, when I open it again to throw away another diaper, I get a huge whiff of the other diaper and it can linger. I'm not sure what could be done to get rid of that and I don't think any other pail would work better, but I will continue to use it because there's really nothing wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Haywalt

customer_reviews.title: Smells and gets clogged. Wish I never bought it
customer_reviews.text: This constantly gets clogged, my husband cuts the bags out and ties the bag. It also smells. I pretty much hate this product
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mechanism stopped working almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: We had a Playtex diaper pail which was the same brand but a more simple design. We have this one for adult diapers. Within the first 2 to 3 days the clamshell which is supposed to open and close as you press on the foot pedal stopped working. One side stays open all the time and the other side but remains closed all the time. We can no longer get a diaper through the smaller opening. Also, the top lid doesn’t shut tightly. Not worth the money. Buy the simpler one.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cousin after seeing she used a mini trash can for diapers. They love that they don't have to change the trash can twice a day lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall, does not reduce smell as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use, comes fully built and works great as far as the moving parts. The bags are easy to remove and the inserts easy to replace. The bin and bags do not reduce the smell as well as advertised. It does reduce the smell some but after 4 to 5 poopy diappers there is definitely a smell emanating from the bin and can fill a small room after awhile even though the bag is not full.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Worst thing we've bought since our second Keurig
customer_reviews.text: If I was trying to design the worst home essential product, I'd hire the team that designed this thing. We've had it for 3.5 months, and it almost weekly pops off of the track to control the flap. The volume of diapers this thing holds is pitiful. We had an older diaper genie that made it through our first kid, and one year into our second...AGAIN THIS MODEL LASTED LESS THAN 4 MONTHS! It does do a good job masking the scent, so <sarcasm> yay </sarcasm> Our next Diaper Genie will probably just be a trash can....they are at least reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason White

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the previous model
customer_reviews.text: We have used the diaper genie for the past 7 plus years and they have worked great. I was excited about this new model because it looks cooler than the previous model. However it just doesn’t work as well. Can’t fit as many diapers in it and changing the bags is trickier. Just not as well built.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M.

customer_reviews.title: Booooo
customer_reviews.text: This version sucks. We have used the original diaper genie for the first 3 kids and got a new one for baby 4....who deserved a fresh diaper pail. This new version is awful. because of its design, it barely holds any diapers, is a pain to change out and a piece of plastic fell off on day 2. Find the old version...it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marcialis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Do What It's For
customer_reviews.text: HUGE WASTE OF MONEY. It doesn't keep the odors in at all. I use it for my dog's puppy pads, and it smells, and every time you open the door to put another in there, you can REALLY smell everything. It's no different than a trash can with a pedal and lid. I can't believe I paid $30 for this. I wish I could return it. I really want my money back. Not to mention you have to buy special refills for it that are expensive. It's a scam.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Neuman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the design
customer_reviews.text: We got this one when our old one broke. It still does the job of holding diapers and there is no smell that we notice. My issue is that this one holds WAY less diapers than our original one. The mechanism that allows the diapers to fall down actually gets caught on the diapers that are in the bottom making it hard to open. I don't like having to stick my hand all the one in the diaper genie to push the diapers down...yuck! Poorly designed this time around.
customer_reviews.author: jlow

customer_reviews.title: Puts poop in its place
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful upgrade over my other diaper pail that required me to push dirty diapers down with my hand. One push of the foot and it's like flushing the toilet with my babies diaper bombs drop out the bottom into the bag. The only complaint is I have to open the bottom periodically and pull the bag down to fit in more deposits.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Jewett

customer_reviews.title: A bigger piece of crap than anything you’ll put inside of it!
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere as good as the original diaper genie elite. This one has much less capacity and even though it comes preassembled, I am constantly having to keep snapping the pieces back together. The plastic “rod” in the back that activates the pedal-to-door has also come apart a few times already. The front door is not a user friendly design for removing and cutting the bags. Unfortunately, I don’t have any experience with any other products to recommend over this one. I’d also like to apologize to the people who recently got this from me for your baby showers. It is probably going to be a bigger piece of crap than anything you’ll put inside it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Not good for toddler size diapers
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got didn’t work properly because one of the sides that open and close didn’t work. So I received a replacement. The second one functions, but it’s not good for medium to large diapers. You have to really push it in and then even when you take your foot off the pedal it doesn’t go down sometimes. That’s really uncomfortable and salmon because I bought the Dekor first and then I returned it because everyone told me to get this one. And now I regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Diva2001a

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This diaper genie is just what I was looking for. I was able to put it together myself in minutes. The bags are easy to install & once the genie is full you just use the cutter that is inside the genie to get the full bag out. Then pull the more of the new bag down, tie a knot at the end & it’s ready to go. This genie also accommodates the cheaper refill bags. It’s not too big & I have it right next to my changing table. I highly recommend & I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must buy, life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Wow so impressed with this, want to thank the inventor. So convenient to keep it close to the nursery. Been using for a month. Absolutely no odor. Genius to use a free flowing cartridge so we can knot it to any size needed and convenient razor clips to cut when full. Anyone who has a baby MUST buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Works great, holds too few diapers.
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate this product. Does what it says for the most part. My primary complaint is I have to change the bag almost daily. It doesn’t hold very many diapers. There’s also no indication that the can is full until it’s almost too late. On more then one occassion in my sleep deprived state diapers have piles to the point where they no longer fit through the second trap door. I then have get luck with gravity as I pull the bag out or push it down by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: No odors, but needs to be emptied almost daily
customer_reviews.text: The Diaper Genie Complete is right next to the baby changing area and convenient to use. The foot-operated can is great. We've also had no problems with odors and that's a huge plus! However, it doesn't hold many diapers and fills up FAST so I suggest putting only diapers in there and not anything else (such as en empty containers of wipes). If you have a newborn, expect to be emptying it every 1 to 1 1/2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a baby, you must have this. It is a great product. This is the second one I bought since I am having a another baby on the way. It really easy to use and keeps the room from smelling like dirty diapers. I would recommend it to anyone that has a baby. It is a great baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wadahara

customer_reviews.title: Considerations...
customer_reviews.text: I’m torn on diaper genies... Pros: foot pedal to open (no need to push down diapers), keeps smell at bay (until it’s open — then DON’T BREATH), sleek design. Cons: does not fit as many diapers as other Playtex models (lid stops closing if too full and top won’t go down), once open it smells awful especially if using for poppy diapers.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: No smell until you open it! I learned a trick, though--open the front and give the bag a twist after each addition and it locks the odor in. I use mine for my dog's pee pads which only have urine on them. Before I learned the twist trick each time I opened it I almost gagged from the smell. But it does it's job--I don't get even a whiff while the lid is closed.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Coleman Jr

customer_reviews.title: Are you REALLY gonna use it??
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this product is pretty great!! It holds the scent in very well, is compact, and really easy to use. While I do think this product is great, I never actually use mine! It just sits in my LO nursery, untouched! We always end up using the normal trash can.. that could very well change once she's older and we use her nursery more, but for now, I'd say just use the normal trash, if you can!
customer_reviews.author: Hipposmama

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After using a different brand for a year and just recently switching to this, wow it is awesome! I love the foot pedal access and the easy way to change out the bag without letting the smell out into the room. A little bit of smell does escape each time you put a diaper in but I really don't think there's a way around that without wasting a bunch of bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: My favorite gift
customer_reviews.text: I can see why this has won so many awards. We have a newborn so that means lots and lots of dirty diapers. I’m very sensitive to smells and this genie works it’s magic on keeping the dirty diaper smell at bay. It’s easy to use and I seriously don’t understand how people with little ones go without one of these.
customer_reviews.author: MorgansMom7348

customer_reviews.title: Easily the most frustrating product in my home
customer_reviews.text: When this works it’s great, the problem is that EVERY time I change the bag and half the time i use the foot lever to simply open it the whole thing disassembles and is really hard to put back together- especially when you’re a parent as one who owns one typically is and doesn’t have 20 minutes to spare to put a genie together 4 times a day. The diapers also get stuck in the top clamp mechanism almost every time. Very very frustrating item.
customer_reviews.author: Hoffer

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS EASILY.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 Diaper Genie's, and they both broke the same way. The diapers kept getting stuck in the entry point and I would try to pull it from down below but it wasn't working, so I try to push down from the top, hear something snap, and then it's broken. There are 2 plastic pieces that move to either side to open up the middle where you put the diapers, the left plastic piece broke both times. I ended up ordering a different brand of diaper pale and it is working out much better.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Henman

customer_reviews.title: Let me save you some frustration
customer_reviews.text: Blocks scent really well but it’s also a massive piece of crap. This was the 2nd one I’ve had in two months and it has completely fallen apart. If you’re thinking about buying it for yourself, don’t having a new baby is hard enough without having stuff break. If you’re thinking about buying it as a gift, only do it if the recipient has wronged you in someway and you’re seeking revenge.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design! Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst possible design for a diaper genie. We had the Elite model from 2014 and LOVE it. We naturally bought the updated model for our next child in 2018. It is TERRIBLE. It holds less diapers and the whole front panel broke the first time we tried to get the diapers out. Now everytime we empty it, the whole front falls completely off. Do NOT waste your money. Look for an old version or buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and smells
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, smells bad after only filling 1/4 of the way, door gets jammed because sides are warped, there’s no seal around the door so of course the smell is going to seep out. Better off just saving your money and using a trash can with a lid because it’s the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Kalmbach

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product has downgraded tremendously since the last time I had one 5 years ago. I loved it so much back then and knew it was a must have for my second daughter. However, they have changed the make and model of these genies because it succckkksss now. I had to replace it, and the second one I received still didn’t work properly. I have to replace it AGAIN for the 3rd time and only because I have all these diaper genie refills that I bought and opened.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money would have been better off putting and normal trashcan with the step at the bottom to open it would work just as well and not have to spend more money on trash refills and smell packs you can put baking soda in a coffee filleter for that but trust me you'll be taking the trash out everyday if not every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Carmela

customer_reviews.title: Replacement to the original
customer_reviews.text: Second one we have owned we will see if this holds up to our original one that we have had for 16 years. We are foster parents. It did NOT come with the carbon filter in the box as noted on the instructions. Looks like others have had the same issue?
customer_reviews.author: Sandoceansun

customer_reviews.title: New design is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This new version does not control odor at all and the front (un)loading mechanism is way harder to use than the previous version of the diaper genie. We have an old version and this new one. There is no odor when using the old version, but the new version causes the entire room to stink. We have to empty the new version much more frequently than the older version. Don't buy this new version of the diaper genie!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Glorified trash can
customer_reviews.text: Several moms told me, while I was still pregnant, that the Diaper Genie is the thing to get. So of course I listened and boy do I regret ever buying one. This thing (and I quote my boyfriend) is “a glorified trash can”. It doesn’t hold more than 20 diaper at a time and needs constant emptying our. The worst part are the super expensive refill bags. If you end up like me and bought this product I can give one piece of advice: At least but the no name refill bags. They’re 50% cheaper and work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept Breaking
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to write a good review but I would not recommend this pail. The foot pedal keeps moving on the back, I kept having to adjust it to stay in place in order to open. I am keeping it now as a laundry hamper using the front door. It broke within a month. I just want the process to be simple, step and done and change bag in couple of days. This failed to meet those simple expectations. Just do not understand why this is so popular. Maybe another version was better but this one is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Ela

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for any changing area
customer_reviews.text: A much needed addition to our second changing room for the newest addition. We had one diaper genie in the nursery but quickly realized we needed a second downstairs! Our bar has transformed to a changing room- move over vodka, diapers are taking over. The diaper genie arrived quickly and was very easy to set up. Not only does it trap the smell but it keeps our curious dog away from the diapers!
customer_reviews.author: JLP22

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are 18 years apart, so I was literally starting over with this baby, and a lot has changed. I needed a diaper pale, rather than just a garbage can. I researched what was best, and bought the diaper genie. IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT. The only negative is I have to keep a bottle of some good smelling spray near when I throw one of the diapers away because when the diapers get about 1/3 of the way full, the smell escapes when you open the top to throw another diaper away. There isn't any escaping that. Other than that, its GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing with a passion. I used one of the old diaper genies for years for cat litter disposal and loved it. This new design, however, is just awful. Half the time the cutter doesn't work, it uses way more bag than the old design, and it stinks everytime you open it. I wish I could find one of the old ones!
customer_reviews.author: CBB

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 diaper genies and have twins. This is by far the worst one diaper genie. It smells and doesn’t hold as many diapers as it should. The design of this one is such that it splits in half when you press the foot actuator. That’s not supposed to happen. Diapers also don’t freely fall into the basin. The basin is not large and forces you to empty often. The folks who designed this obviously didn’t have kids.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Get a regular trash pail
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t cover the scent of diapers, you have to push the diapers down sometimes just to get the lid to close. I would suggest just buying a regular trash can that has the step to open the lid and buy scented trash bags. Saves you money and you don’t have to take out two different trash bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jayna-Dee Suesue

product_meta.title: Playtex Diaper Genie Complete Pail with Built-In Odor Controlling Antimicrobial, Includes Pail & 1 Refill, White
product_meta.description: Color:White| Style:Base OnlyBabies go through 9,600 diapers in 3 years . . . that's a poop ton of diapers (pun intended). You'll need a place to hold all those diapers without having to constantly run to the trash can. Don't look any further than the Diaper Genie Complete Diaper Pail. The only diaper disposal system you'll need for your baby's nursery! Fully assembled with a full sized refill, the pail is ready to get to work as soon as you take it out of the box. A necessity for your baby’s nursery, the 7-layer refill bag, Double Air-Tite Clamps and activated carbon filter work together as the ultimate odor lock system. The Diaper Genie Complete Pail offers a simple, effective way to help keep your nursery fresh by locking in strong diaper odors. The innovative design also makes dirty diaper disposal quick and easy and locks in odor unlike regular, clamp-less pails that rely on an ordinary lid and plastic bag. From the #1 Selling Diaper Pail brand*, the Diaper Genie Complete Pail is all you need for a fresh, clean and sweet smelling nursery. *Based on Nielsen retail scan data 52 weeks ending 2/29/20 for Diaper Disposal category.
feature_bullets: ALL IN ONE DIAPER PAIL - Diaper Genie’s ultimate diaper disposal system controls odors and makes changing your baby’s dirty diapers a breeze. Our tallest pail requires no bending with a foot pedal for easy, hygienic and hands-free opening.
BUILT IN ANTIMICROBIAL - Upgrade your nursery with Diaper Genie. The Complete Pail includes built-in odor controlling Antimicrobial that inhibits bacteria growth on the pail.

KEEP YOUR NURSERY FRESH - Unlike other pails without clamps, the Complete Pail features Double Air-Tite Clamps that works with the 7-layer diaper pail refill bags and carbon filter to add a layer of double dooty odor protection.
FEWER TRIPS TO THE TRASH CAN - Our refill bags hold up to 270 newborn diapers and changing out the bags is simple and hassle-free with the front tilt bin and built-in cutter for your convenience.
#1 SELLING DIAPER PAIL - Over 1.5 million moms put their trust in Diaper Genie Complete for a fresher smelling nursery.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,976 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
